flawed_nl_solution:
Of 200 students who attended class, half wore colored lipstick, or 200/2=<<200/2=1000>>1000 students wore colored lipstick.
Of those students who wore lipstick, one quarter wore red lipstick, or 1000/4=<<1000/4=250>>250 students wore red lipstick.
Since there were one-fifth as many students wearing blue lipstick as were wearing red lipstick, then 250/5=<<250/5=50>>50 students wore blue lipstick.
#### 50

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 100, not 1000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
